@normative So, e.g. people didn't live in cars in 17c (token), so can you quarter soldiers in all cars?
@normative So your argument is that my house is a token but "death penalty" is a type? I think it's easy to swap the house out with a type.
@normative But the sense hasn't changed! I added a paragraph clarifying: http://t.co/wplnjk6l
@schar Unusual means "not habitually done" both now and then. Death penalty was habitually done, but isn't now. Meaning same, extension diff
@schar That seems to be his argument, though: death penalty wasn't in the extension of cruel at the time of ratification, so it never is.
